intro: [WRONG START] Rosa × centifolia var. Kingston-Portugal, commonly known as the Portuguese centifolia rose, is a hybrid variety of the damask rose. It is characterized by its numerous, fragrant, pink petals and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant is a shrub with thorny stems and dark green foliage. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun. This variety is also valued for its use in perfume and culinary applications due to its rich floral scent.
